parameter.name: onlineTimeout
parameter.label: Online timeout
parameter.description: Bluetooth devices not showing any activity are considered to be offline after exceeding this timeout (seconds).

parameter.name: rssiFilterType
parameter.label: Received signal strength indication (RSSI) filter
parameter.description: RSSI filter removes noise and spikes from RSSI in order to allow more precise estimation of bluetooth device position relative to bluetooth adapters. The downside of applying RSSI filter is introducing some latency in changing RSSI value. For example, if a strong (slow) filter is applied, then the filtered RSSI curve follows the real RSSI readings with a delay. If a weak (fast) filter is applied, then the filtered RSSI curve becomes more responsive, but gains more spikes (noise).

parameter.name: txPowerMeasured
parameter.label: Measured transmit power (Tx Power)
parameter.description:
Measured/estimated (user defined) Tx power of the device that is measured 1 meter away from the adapter (RSSI value).
This parameter is used in distance estimation between the device and an adapter. If it is set to 0 (or omitted) and:
  • If the device advertises its Tx Power (e.g. beacon devices), then the advertised Tx Power is used.
  • If the device does not advertise its Tx Power, then the defaul Tx Power value is used: -60.

parameter.name: connectionStrategy
parameter.label: Connection strategy
parameter.description:
Connection strategy that is to be used when the "connection control" is enabled. The following strategies are supported:
  • Nearest adapter: the nearest adapter is selected automatically.
        Note: the selected adapter won't be changed while the device is connected even if the selected adapter is no longer the nearest. If disconnected, a new nearest adapter might be selected.
  • Preferred adapter: adapter is specified by user.

parameter.name: preferredAdapter
parameter.label: Preferred adapter
parameter.description: Note: it is used only when "Preferred adapter" connection strategy is selected.

parameter.name: signalPropagationExponent
parameter.label: Signal propagation exponent
parameter.description: Estimated (user defined) signal propagation exponent. This parameter is used in distance estimation between the adapter and bluetooth devices. This factor is specific to the surrounding environment, i.e. how efficient the signal passes through obstacles on its way.
